paper_abstract: We study the following optimization problem. The input is a number and a directed graph with a specified "start" vertex, each of whose vertices may have one "memory bank requirement", an integer. There are "registers", labeled . A valid solution associates to the vertices with no bank requirement one or more "load instructions" , for bank and register , such that every directed trail from the start vertex to some vertex with bank requirement contains a vertex that has been associated (for some register ) and no vertex following in the trail has been associated an , for any other bank . The objective is to minimize the total number of associated load instructions. We give a -approximation algorithm based on linear programming rounding, with being the best possible unless Vertex Cover has approximation for . We also present a approximation, with being the number of vertices in the input directed graph. Based on the same linear program, another rounding method outputs a valid solution with objective at most times the optimum for registers, using registers.
